article:
{{Infobox aviation |name=Wingspan |image=Image:aer.lingus.a320-200.ei-
cva.planform.arp.jpg |caption=The distance A to B is the wingspan of this Aer
Lingus Airbus A320. }}

The 'wingspan' (or just 'span') of an airplane or a bird, is the distance from
one wingtip to the other wingtip. For example, the Boeing 777 has a wingspan of
about ; and a Wandering Albatross (Diomedea exulans) caught in 1965 had a
wingspan of , the official record for a living bird.

The term wingspan, more technically 'extent', is also used for other winged
animals such as pterosaurs, bats, insects, etc., and other winged aircraft such
as ornithopters.
headings: Armspan in sports (Commonly also called Wingspan)
